body:
Hi Steve,


The file "blackbody.cal" just defines a couple of functions, cct_x(t)  
and cct_y(t).  You can use these in icalc or rcalc, like so:


% icalc blackbody.cal
cct_x(2200)
$1=0.5056338
cct_y(2200)
$2=0.4152074


% echo 2200 | rcalc -f blackbody.cal -e '$1=cct_x($1);$2=cct_y($1)'
0.5056338       0.4152074


If you want to go from CIE (x,y) to Radiance RGB, use in combination  
with xyz_rgb.cal like so:


% echo 2200 100 | rcalc -f blackbody.cal -f xyz_rgb.cal \
	-e 'xi=cct_x($1);yi=cct_y($1)' -e 'Yi=$2;Xi=Yi*yi/xi;Zi=Yi*(1-xi-yi)/ 
yi' \
	-e '$1=R(Xi,Yi,Zi);$2=G(Xi,Yi,Zi);$3=B(Xi,Yi,Zi)'


In this case, the second input field (100) is the Y value.


I hope this helps.
-Greg
